Sentence: Wynand and Roark meet and become fast friends, but Wynand does not know the truth about Roark's relationship with Dominique
When Roark returns from a summer-long yacht trip with Wynand, he (Roark) finds that, despite the agreement, the Cortlandt Homes project has been changed
The entire country condemns Roark, but Wynand finally finds the courage to follow his (Roark) convictions and orders his (Roark) newspapers to defend him (Roark)
Eventually, Wynand gives in and denounces Roark
Wynand asks Roark to design one last building, a skyscraper that will testify to the supremacy of man
